value.name: $5 million settlement reached after Bexar County sheriff's deputies shot, killed 6-year-old boy
value.description: The family of Kameron Prescott, a 6-year-old boy who was shot and killed by Bexar County sheriff’s deputies in 2017, has reached a $5 million settlement in a civil lawsuit against the county. Under terms of the settlement,

value.name: Kameron Prescott's family reaches settlement with Bexar County more than three years after fatal shooting
value.description: More than three years after a 6-year-old Schertz boy, Kameron Prescott, was killed by law enforcement as they were pursuing a fugitive, his family has reached a settlement with Bexar County, court records show.

video.name: Three years after BCSO deputies shot and killed 6-year-old Kameron Prescott, his mom still wants justice

value.name: Settlement agreement reached in 2017 Kameron Prescott fatal shooting case
value.description: A settlement agreement has been reached in a federal lawsuit in the 2017 death of 6-year-old Kameron Prescott, who was shot and killed inside of his mobile home when Bexar County deputies fired ...

value.name: Police shootings of children spark new outcry, calls for training to deal with adolescents in crisis
value.description: A Washington Post database of fatal force incidents finds most children shot by police are minorities and less likely to be armed than adults shot by police.

value.name: Update | Missing 61-year-old woman found in San Antonio
value.description: The San Antonio Police Department has found a previously missing 61-year-old woman. Briggette Lorraine Luke had been missing since Tuesday, May 18. She was found Friday. Luke is 5'9" and weighs around 220 pounds.

value.name: One person dead after falling under VIA bus, ran over
value.description: The person slipped while running and fell under the bus's rear tires. The San Antonio Police Department said the victim was dead as a result of the incident. No other details were available.
